channel.title: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!
channel.description: Yes, yes, I know: "What? You have WINS98?? LMAO!!" I'm need to know how to set EPB Fiber Optics up on WINS98. HELP??

item.title: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Charles_Handson Charles Handson
item.description:
@Charles_Handson wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:413716”]Google for drivers, if you can’t find one, then you might have to get another ethernet card that does have win98 drivers.

Honestly, on a faster computer, you would probably be better off installing win98 in a virtual machine, I’d recommend VirtualBox.[/quote]

Hmm… I’ll try that. Thanks! (:

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!

item.title: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Google for drivers, if you can’t find one, then you might have to get another ethernet card that does have win98 drivers.

Honestly, on a faster computer, you would probably be better off installing win98 in a virtual machine, I’d recommend VirtualBox.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!

item.title: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Charles_Handson Charles Handson
item.description:
@Charles_Handson wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Is it just standard ethernet? I think it should just work, I’ve had machines set up like that.

No. I have it installed on a faster computer. I didn’t have any other installation discs. The WIN98 system isn’t able to reconize the PCI Enthernet Card, or something like that.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!

item.title: Setting up internet on WINS98 HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:4, topic:413716”][quote author=Newty link=topic=515678.msg3741470#msg3741470 date=1315398887]
Why not download a free distribution of Linux?
[/quote]Because Windows 98 has cutting-edge software such as IE4 and the new & improved Dr. Watson utility.[/quote]Don’t forget plug and play!

Read full topic
